doc.after: About 88%[106] of the population of Tamil Nadu are Hindus. Christians and Muslims account for 6% and 5.5% respectively.[106] The majority of Muslims in Tamil Nadu speak Tamil,[107] with less than 15% of them reporting Urdu as their mother tongue.[108] Tamil Jains number only a few thousand now.[109] Atheist, rationalist, and humanist philosophies are also adhered by sizeable minorities, as a result of Tamil cultural revivalism in the 20th century, and its antipathy to what it saw as Brahminical Hinduism.[110]
